title: Authors and Citation
text: Jamieson E (2025). didintrjl: Intersection Difference--Differences. R package version 0.0.2, https://ebjamieson97.github.io/didintrjl/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {didintrjl: Intersection Difference-in-Differences},   author = {Eric Jamieson},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.2},   url = {https://ebjamieson97.github.io/didintrjl/}, }

title: Intersection Difference-in-Differences
text: didintrjl R wrapper Julia package DiDInt.jl, implements intersection difference--differences (-INT), method developed Karim & Webb (2025). -INT allows unbiased estimation average effect treatment treated (ATT) cases common causal covariates (CCC) assumption violated.

title: Intersection Difference-in-Differences
text: can install development version didintrjl :

title: Intersection Difference-in-Differences
text: didint() function returns object class DiDIntObj three S3 methods: print(), summary(), coef(). methods argument level can take either "agg" "sub" order distinguish aggregate results sub-aggregate results. example, staggered adoption setting several different treatment times, setting level = "sub" return information pertinent distinct treatment times, whereas level = "agg" return aggregated results.
code: # Load data df <- read.csv("inst/extdata/merit.csv")  # Load didintrjl and run didint() library(didintrjl) res <- didint("coll", "state", "year", df, verbose = FALSE,               treated_states = c(71, 58, 64, 59, 85, 57, 72, 61, 34, 88),               treatment_times = c(1991, 1993, 1996, 1997, 1997, 1998, 1998, 1999, 2000, 2000)) #> Starting Julia ...  # Print aggregate and then sub-aggregate results summary(res) #>  #>   Model Specification: Two-way DID-INT #>   Weighting: both #>   Aggregation: cohort #>   Period Length: 1 year #>   First Period: 1989 #>   Last Period: 2000 #>   Permutations: 999 #>  #>         ATT Std. Error    p-value RI p-value Jackknife SE Jackknife p-value #>  0.04582252 0.01440005 0.01902511  0.1091091   0.01333186         0.0138506 summary(res, level = "sub") #>  #>   Model Specification: Two-way DID-INT #>   Weighting: both #>   Aggregation: cohort #>   Period Length: 1 year #>   First Period: 1989 #>   Last Period: 2000 #>   Permutations: 999 #>  #> Treatment Time              ATT         SE    p-value   RI p-val      JK SE   JK p-val     Weight #> --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  #> 1991-01-01               0.0529     0.0244     0.0307     0.5075     0.0244     0.0305     0.2018 #> 1993-01-01               0.0236     0.0186     0.2044     0.6717     0.0185     0.2037     0.1915 #> 1996-01-01               0.0564     0.0295     0.0572     0.4645     0.0294     0.0566     0.0757 #> 1997-01-01               0.0711     0.0271     0.0094     0.2252     0.0270     0.0092     0.3211 #> 1998-01-01               0.0485     0.0389     0.2146     0.4795     0.0388     0.2128     0.1086 #> 1999-01-01               0.0120     0.0207     0.5629     0.8719     0.0206     0.5606     0.0355 #> 2000-01-01              -0.0331     0.0976     0.7364     0.6887     0.0964     0.7334     0.0658

what: Estimate the ATT using DID-INT — didint
title: Estimate the ATT using DID-INT — didint
text: didint() estimates average effect treatment treated (ATT) using intersection difference--differences developped Karim & Webb (2025). method adjusts covariates may vary across states, time, jointly state time. function R wrapper around Julia implementation provided Didint.jl package. details visit didintrjl documentation site: https://ebjamieson97.github.io/didintrjl/.

title: Estimate the ATT using DID-INT — didint
code: didint(   outcome,   state,   time,   data,   gvar = NULL,   treated_states = NULL,   treatment_times = NULL,   date_format = NULL,   covariates = NULL,   ccc = "int",   agg = "cohort",   weighting = "both",   ref = NULL,   freq = NULL,   freq_multiplier = 1,   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   nperm = 999,   verbose = TRUE,   seed = sample.int(1e+06, 1),   notyet = NULL,   hc = "hc3" )

title: Estimate the ATT using DID-INT — didint
text: outcome string giving column name outcome variable. state string giving column identifying states. state column character column. time string giving column identifying dates. data data frame containing variables used estimation. gvar String giving column indicates first treatment time state. Use either option combination treated_states treatment_times. treated_states Character values specifying treated state(s). treatment_times Specify treated_states using strings, numbers, Dates, corresponding treated_states. date_format Optional string specifying input date format dates supplied character strings. Applies start_date, end_date, treatment_times data time column strings. covariates Optional string vector strings specifying covariates include. ccc string specifying -INT specification. One "hom", "time", "state", "add", "int" (default "int"). agg string indicating aggregation method. One "cohort", "simple", "state", "sgt", "time" "none". weighting Weighting scheme use. One "", "att", "diff", "none". ref Optional named list indicating reference category categorical covariates. freq Optional string specifying period length staggered adoption. One "year", "month", "week", "day". freq_multiplier Integer multiplier freq. Default 1. start_date Optional earliest date retain data. end_date Optional latest date retain data. nperm Number permutations randomization inference. Default 999. verbose Logical value, TRUE, prints progress randomization inference procedure. seed Integer seed randomization inference. notyet Logical value TRUE, uses pre-treatment periods treated states controls. hc Heteroskedasticity-consistent covariance matrix estimator. One "hc0", "hc1", "hc2", "hc3", "hc4".

title: Estimate the ATT using DID-INT — didint
text: Results. ATT, p-values etc.

title: Estimate the ATT using DID-INT — didint
text: arguments treated_states treatment_times must supplied ordering corresponds one another. , first element treated_states refers state treated date given first element treatment_times, . Dates can entered strings, numbers, Date objects. character strings supplied, input format must specified via date_format argument (e.g. "yyyy-mm-dd"). Period grids staggered adoption constructed automatically, based inputted data. Otherwise, period grid can created manually using arguments freq, freq_multiplier, start_date, end_date. information process can seen didintrjl documentation site: https://ebjamieson97.github.io/didintrjl/.

title: Estimate the ATT using DID-INT — didint
text: Karim & Webb (2025). Good Controls Gone Bad: Difference--Differences Covariates. https://arxiv.org/abs/2412.14447 MacKinnon & Webb (2020). Randomization inference difference--differences treated clusters. doi:10.1016/j.jeconom.2020.04.024

title: didintrjl 0.0.2
text: Added coef() summary() methods DiDIntObj.

title: didintrjl 0.0.1
text: Switched using JuliaCall now using JuliaConnectoR. didint() now returns S3 object class DiDIntObj instead raw dataframe. Added print() method DiDIntObj objects level argument display aggregate sub-aggregate results via "agg" "sub" options.

title: didintrjl 0.0.0.9000
text: Initial package setup.
